text.title: Make South African White Pap
text.head: Make South African White Pap
text.p: Maize Meal is a relatively coarse flour ( much coarser than corn flour or cornstarch). . he Portuguese had originally brought corn or maize as it is known in Southern Africa from the Americas to Africa . In the USA grits is the closets equivalent . This food was originally eaten by the Voortrekkers during The Great Trek has become the diet staple of South Africa . Because of its ability to be stored without refrigeration , it is cheap and abundant in all shops and markets . It is also a food staple in Mozambique , Lesotho , Swaziland , Zambia , Zimbabwe , Malawi , Botswana and many other parts of Southern Africa . Traditionally maize meal is made into uphuthu , sour-milk porridge , pap , and also Umqombothi ( a type of beer ) . The raw ingredient of Maize meal is added to boiling water , the ratio of which produces either porridge or the firmer pap . For a creamier dish , milk is added to produce porridge with a thick texture and is commonly eaten for breakfast in southern Africa . The firmer pap is eaten with meat and gravy dishes as well as vegetables .
text.head: Steps

list.item: Begin with water in the pot . The ingredients are : 4 cups Water ; 1 tsp Salt ; 1 cup Maize meal . *Please note that you can use the same ingredients for making pap and porridge .

Bring the water to a boil for Pap . Set the temperature of your stove to 25 degrees C. Add salt to taste . Add 3 cups of maize meal and stir with a wooden spoon/fork until thick and smooth . Reduce the heat and simmer 30 minutes stirring occasionally ( 3 to 4 times ) , until the pap is thick , stiff and cooked through .
Serve the cooked Pap . When cooked pap can be served with almost anything . South Africans love it with different kinds of side dishes : Meat , Salads , Stews and with Milk .

Bring the water to a boil for Porridge . Set the temperature of your stove to 25 degrees C. Add salt to taste . In a bowl , mix maize meal with cold water . Make sure it is smooth before pouring into the hot pot . Pour and stir the maize meal into the boiling water . Keep on on stirring until iti s well mixed . Let it simmer for at 30 minutes with the lid on . Add a spoon of butter and mix it up .
Serve the porridge with milk and sugar /honey .

text.head: Tips

list.item: Pap is an amazing staple food for the African people . Most African homes serve pap on a daily basis . It can be served with side dishes like meat , salads , different kinds of soups . You can even serve it with famatted milk ( fermented milk i.e. yoghurt ? ) and sugar ! It has even modified it to cook in less time . There are a lot of brands , but White Star is recommended .
Porridge is mostly for mornings . Make sure when making , it is smooth . You can either have white or brown porridge . For flavor , you can add sugar and milk . It is easy for kids to eat .
When cooking , kids should not be near the pot . The maize meal pops while it is being poured into the pot . So be careful .
